type: Acquisition of a diesel engine trainer for
description: PWGSC, on behalf of the Department of national defense (DND) is issuing this REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL (RFP) for the supply and delivery of a diesel engine trainer located in Oromocto (NB, Canada), as detailed in Annex Requirement.
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## Title
**Acquisition of a Diesel Engine Trainer for the Department of National Defence**

## Reference Number and Solicitation Number
WS4218774849, solicitation number WS4218774849

## Tender Status and Publication Date
* **Status:** Expired
* **Publication Date:** 01 November 2023

## Key Details

### Contract Requirements
The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is issuing a request for proposal (RFP) for the supply and delivery of a diesel engine trainer. The equipment is to be located in Oromocto, New Brunswick, Canada.

### Procurement Method
* **Method:** Competitive, open bidding
* **Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price

### Trade Agreements
This tender is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

### Contracting Entity and End-User
* **Contracting Entity:** Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **End-User:** Department of National Defence (DND)

### Contact Information
For any inquiries or clarification, please contact Adina Ayassou at PSPC, adina.ayassou@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

### Additional Information

Please visit the following webpage for the complete announcement and attachments:

* **Notice URL:** https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17887653?extsite=MTc4ODc2NTNfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

 **Industry Codes:**
* **UNSPC:** 26101504 – Diesel Engines
**Regions of Delivery:**
* **Canada**

## Timelines

* **Expected Contract Start Date:** 31 October 2023
* **Tender Closing Date:** expired on 04 Dec 2023 14:00:00

Please be advised that this entry has expired and is no longer valid. Any bid applications will not be accepted. 

Note: This is a rewritten version of the contractor's shared document, condensing the important information into a 400-word limit. I removed unnecessary and redundant information, while maintaining a clear and readable format.  Each section is separated with clear headings, providing an easier understanding of the key points in the tender announcement.

This revised text includes the following changes:

*   Reorganized format for readability
*   Grouped key information into sections
*   Shortened the announcement to fit within a 400-word limit
*   Corrected
